metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14865 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the grub2-set-bootflag utility of grub2. A local attacker could run this utility under resource pressure (for example by setting RLIMIT), causing grub2 configuration files to be truncated and leaving the system unbootable on subsequent reboots.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this issue is in a Red Hat-specific patch

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
